thread.title: Spanish supermarkets hoard fruit and veg while Brit shoppers are being rationed
thread.title_full: Spanish supermarkets hoard fruit and veg while Brit shoppers are being rationed

author: tbowman
title: Spanish supermarkets hoard fruit and veg while Brit shoppers are being rationed
text:
Spanish supermarkets hoard fruit and veg while Brit shoppers are being rationed 
Spaniards stockpile five-a-day as British consumers show signs of panic buying By DANIEL JONES Comments SPANISH supermarkets are stockpiling lettuce and other veg even though British shoppers are being rationed. 
Aisles overseas are overflowing with salad veg while shoppers at home are having to go short. SWNS:South West News Service 4 Signs of panic as Sainsbury’s shelves sit empty in Chelmsford 
Some UK stores have run out of sweet gem and romaine lettuces. Tesco and Morrisons are limiting customers to three icebergs each amid signs of panic buying. Experts blame a drought and cold spell in Murcia, Spain, which grows nine in ten UK-sold lettuces. Dieter Lloyd, of the Leafy Salad Growers Association, said: “People are getting very surprised by the notion of rationing.” EPA 4 Spanish producers show off produce at gastronomy event 
But gardening guru Alan Titchmarsh said of the shortage: “It reminds people not to take food and food producers for granted.” related stories Council slammed as racist after naming crackdown on dodgy drivers 'Operation India' NHS 'SEX RING' EXPOSED Two doctors quit after exchanging coded emails to arrange romps with staff at top hospital 'DONALD'S A MORON' Prince Harry slams Trump's election as 'terrifying' and 'condemns his policies to friends' ‘Murder by acid' Woman charged with murder after ex dies 15 months after UK's first fatal acid attack BORDER FARCE Immigration chiefs prepare to throw nan out of UK after 27yrs because she spent too long with dying parents RAY OF SUNSHINE David Hockney's transformation of The Sun's logo hailed as 'genius' and an 'optimistic vision of the world's beauty' fool conti Actor Tom Conti fights to stop Tesco coverting Budgens - despite it being a mile away from his £17.5m home 'I GOT MY EYE ON YOU' Father hunted by cops over 2008 'honour killing' of his two daughters filmed pair in bed in disturbing video that also shows his gun 'I'M NOT A F***ING BOY' Entrepreneur acquitted of harassing a transgender woman and calling her an 'old geezer' JAMES FORSYTH With the average London house to cost £1million by 2022 - home owners will make or break Theresa May TRAVEL BAN TRUMPED Judge puts block on controversial 'Muslim ban' that caused chaos across US GOING, GOING, DONG! Erotic Valentine's auction at Sotheby's offering a penis table, orgy necklace and saucy sketches 
In Spain, we saw dozens of icebergs for sale at Mercadona supermarket in Molina de Segura, Murcia. 4 No way Jose! Spanish supermarket shelves overflow 
Brits hit out. Lucy Stewart, 28, from Beckenham, South East London, seethed: “It’s sickening. The Spaniards should make sure more gets to us.” The bad weather in Spain is also causing a shortage of tomatoes, broccoli, spinach, cabbage and courgettes. Getty Images 4 Warning signs say fruit and veg could soon cost an Armada-and-a-leg 
Marie Webb, 57, with mum Jo Osmond, 81, outside Sainsbury’s in Filton, Bristol, said: “I have to say the shelves are looking a little bare.” Getting your kid to enjoy their fruit and veg doesn’t have to be a chore
